column4: first of all: which driver and which gaphic card are you suing?
*using
how can i check please?
can you paste the whole "/var/log/Xorg.0.log" file?
sure, here it is: http://paste.ubuntu.com/644304/

you have to start nvidia-settings and set the screen size there. Dont just click apply, also use the option "save to X Configuration File". I recommend you to use "gksu nvidia-settings". you have to reboot after you did that
i have to change resolution in section Display -> panning? and i write 1680x1050 right?
I think so ;)
I written 1680x1050 but I received a message: layout has some inconsistencies, â€¢ MetaMode 11 of Screen 0 is the same as MetaMode 1.  All MetaModes must be unique.
try to delete all unecessary metamodes under "X Screen" in nvidia-settings
no changes yet I deleted modes but still not have 1680x1050
have you saved the configuration to that x-file thing and have you rebooted since then?
I reboot now try
I feel stupid with my standard mouse and keyboard. Maybe I should connect the cell phone with the computer and write with the cellphone keyboard, Dr_Willis, that would be even more nerdy ;)
fixed?
I reboot now I have to use mouse to see the whole desktop resolution
font are the same as 1024x768
so the picture is scrolling when you move the mouse the the screencorners?
yes i have to scrolling right, left, up down...
are you sure that your screen is supporting that resolution?
yes In my win7 i'm using 1680x1050
may I have post another logs?
I have no Idea if I can help you with that issue, you could try the gtf command, exempli gratia by typing "gtf 1680 1050 60" that will return a possible modeline

but Im running out of time, sorry that I couldn't help you. You could ask again in the channel. Panning seems to be the wrong option that is when your virtual screen size is bigger then your physical screen size, so the best way to configure your screen size would be if you edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf manually, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/X/Config/Resolution#Dynamically_testing_different_resolutions for more information
